qas.question: Who was known as being a founder of humanism thought in China?
What early adopter and developer of is associated with Confucianism?
Who is known for the thought that humanity is the most important thing in the world?
Who was known as being a founder of humanism thought in Finland?
What early adopter and developer is no longer associated with Confucianism?
Whose words were hidden by the Book of HIstory?
Who is known for the thought that humanity is the least important thing in the world?

context: In China, <a0_0><b3_0>Yellow Emperor<b3_0/><a0_0/> is regarded as the humanistic primogenitor.[citation needed] Sage kings such as Yao and Shun are humanistic figures as recorded.[citation needed] <b6_0>King <a2_0>Wu of Zhou<b6_0/><a2_0/> has the famous saying: "Humanity is the Ling (efficacious essence) of the world (among all)." Among them <b4_0><b5_0>Duke of Zhou<b5_0/><b4_0/>, respected as a founder of Rujia (Confucianism), is especially prominent and pioneering in humanistic thought. His words were recorded in the <a1_0>Book of History<a1_0/> as follows (translation):[citation needed]
